alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Okfuskee County through 245 AM CDT... At 215 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Yeager, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Weleetka... Bearden... Clearview... Pharoah... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
